answers.answer: It is known that diabetes causes one to be more susceptible to infections. There are OTC medications available but are usually on the weaker side. A visit to your doctor to ensure the blisters are not caused by Thrush and an Rx for pharmaceutical strength oral medication should be helpful. Good luck -

question: For the last several months I've been getting fever blisters on either the right side of my lower lip or on the left side of my upper lip. Two days ago, my lips started to itch so I applied Carmex  to be on the safe side. This morning my lips are totally covered with fever blisters. I have no idea what's going on. What can I do to get rid of them and can my type 2 diabetes be causing this?
title: Fever Blisters/Type 2 Diabetes
